intro: Psychotria batopedina, commonly known as the Batopedina Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria batopedina is often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities for its purported medicinal properties.
